doc.name: of
doc.summary: Designates the object a property belongs to, or the parameter of a function, or the string that contains a chunk expression.

examples.example: set the backgroundColor of field "Alert" to red
put word 12 of it after field "Go On"

description.p: Use the of keyword to designate an attribute of an object or chunk, or to designate a parameter of a built-in function.
When designating a property, use the of keyword between the property name and the object reference. (The of keyword is not used when referring to global properties, only properties of objects.)
In an expression that includes a built-in function with one parameter, you can use either of two forms:
The of keyword cannot be used for custom functions, or for built-in functions with more than one parameter.

When designating a part of a string, use the of keyword after the chunk type. For example, to specify the first word of a string, use an expression like word 1 of string. In complex chunk expressions with multiple chunk types, use the of keyword after each chunk type. For example, to specify the last character of the second line of a string, use an expression like this:

p.code: last char of line 2 of string

description.p: When designating the number of chunks in a string, use the of keyword after the chunk type. For example, to get the number of lines in a string, use an expression like this:

p.code: the number of lines of string
